question: I love you, Mr. Powers.
answer: And I love you, Mrs. Powers.

question: Let's go out on the terrace. It's a beautiful night, we can look at the stars.
answer: Look how beautiful the night sky is.

question: Isn't that the big dipper?
answer: Yeah, and that looks just like Uranus.

question: Austin!
answer: Well, you know.

question: Hey, I've never seen that big star before.
answer: Yeah, what is that?

question: Please welcome Tim. Now Scott, tell us about your father. Share with us.
answer: Well he's the head of an evil organization that has aspirations for world domination.

question: And where is your father right now?
answer: He's in outer space, like frozen in a giant egg and stuffed inside a Big Boy rocket with his cat, Mr. Bigglesworth.

question: They offered me a free makeover.
answer: Dr. Evil, we've seen a lot of the fathers here today open up to their sons, sons to the fathers. Is there anything you'd like to share?

question: Share?
answer: Yes, don't you have any secrets?

question: No one talks to my boy that way! I'm OK, I'm OK. Come Scott, let's go to daddy's new evil lair.
answer: Dr. Evil, as the legitimate frontman of your organization, I seized upon the opportunity to invest in a small Seattle-based coffee company several years ago. Today, Starbucks is a far- flung empire with 2000 outlets worldwide.

question: Oh good, Number Two, I do enjoy a good cuppa joe.
answer: If I may continue, I believe if we shift our resources away from world domination and focus on providing premium quality coffee drinks, we can increase our gross profits fivefold.

question: Right. Perhaps you've confused me with someone who gives a shit. Might I remind you that I run the show here? I demand a little respect.
answer: Dr. Evil, I think you--

question: Silence! I will not tolerate your insolence! Remember what happened last time.
answer: May I add, I appreciate you reinstating me after our little... misunderstanding.

question: Frau Farbissina. Wie gehts is einen?
answer: Zehr gut, Herr Doctor.

question: How are things?
answer: I have come to embrace the love that dare not speak it's name. To my right is my lover. Her name is Unibrau. I met her on the LPGA Tour.

question: Right on. Welcome, Unibrau.
answer: Doctor, you have a 'milk mustache.'

question: Oh, I know. I know.
answer: Dr. Evil, I'd like to introduce the Greek assassin, Oedipus.

question: Welcome to my private army, Oedipus. Excited? Kiss your mother with that mouth? Of course you do.
answer: Dr. Evil, as you know, the rate at which you liquidate henchmen far exceeds our ability to replace them.

question: I have so few pleasures left to me, Number Two. The key to life is to rotate your vices. One day it's executions, another day it's creamy French cheese. It's like frickin' heroin.
answer: Well, Dr. Evil, perhaps I have the answer. While you were frozen, we began a program to clone you.

question: Cool.
answer: We had a few glitches, but I think you'll be pleased with the results.

question: He is identical to you in every way, except he is one-eighth your size.
answer: Breathtaking. I shall call him Mini- Me. Mini-Me, you will sit to my right. Come Mr. Bigglesworth! Mini-me, something to eat? No? With a White House intern!

question: Uh-hem.
answer: What, that already happened? This is ri-goddamn-diculous. Oh well, how about a frickin' time machine? Does the president have a time machine? Have I been scooped on that?

question: No, not that I'm aware of.
answer: Alright, time machine it is. As you know, every diabolical scheme I've hatched has been thwarted by Austin Powers. And why is that, ladies and gentlemen?

question: No, no, no.
answer: Dr. Evil, wouldn't it be easier to use your knowledge of the future to play the stock market? We could literally make trillions.

question: Why make trillions when we could make... Billions?
answer: Excuse me?

question: Why think small is all I'm saying.
answer: A trillion is more than a billion, numb-nuts.

question: Zip it. Unveil the time portal! Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the time portal. As you know, Austin Powers was frozen in 1967. Therefore, I time travel to 1969, two years after he was frozen. Security will be lax and I'll strike when he is totally helpless.
answer: Can I come?

question: Gor blimey, I'm on empty! That's funny, I just filled the Shaguar up this morning.
answer: Hello, I'm Basil Exposition, head of British Intelligence.

question: You always are, Basil. Listen, the weirdest thing just happened, I've run out of petrol.
answer: We'll send a man around immediately. How was your honeymoon?

question: Vanessa tried to kill me, Basil. She was a Fembot!
answer: Ah women, who can understand them? Moving on, let's discuss your new case.

question: New case? Very shagadelic, Basil!
answer: You'll be doing a photo shoot. We know that one of the models is an ex- KGB agent selling top secret material to the highest bidder.

question: That sounds easy enough, you know what they say Tres chic, baby. Ta, Reg. Bless your cotton socks. Hey, Reg, do you have any hobbies? Hobbies, man! I for one enjoy making models! One at a time, girls. One. At. A. Time! Of course you haven't had "The Pleasure", we just met, baby, yeah! Thank you. Your breasts are amazing. And what's your name, baby? Excuse me?
answer: Ivana. Ivana Humpalot.

question: And I vanna toilet made of solid gold but it's just not in the cards, now is it? Now, which one is the Russian spy? Cindy Crawford, Rebecca Romajin... or Ivana Humpalot? Think, man, think! Alright, baby! Love it. Turn and pout for me baby! Smashing! Great, darling. Give me some shoulder. Yes, yes, yes. No! No! Show me love. Smashing! You're an animal. You're a tiger. Be a tiger, baby! You're great! You're Grrrrrr- eat! You're Tony, be corn flakes, baby, be frosted. Now be a lemur, baby! You're a ring-tailed lemur. A small mammal native to the African savannah. C'mon baby, you know. Like this! OK, predator coming! Now, burrow, burrow! You're a lemur. It's all you've got. I take it back. Be a tiger again. Smashing! And... done! I'm spent! I didn't forget, baby. Miss Humpalot and I are going to have a 'private session'.
answer: When did you get "The Clapper"?

question: November, 1964, Dutch East Indies, shore leave.
answer: Are you cold, Mr. Powers?

question: I once had a bad experience with frostbite. I had to dip my tadger into a brandy snifter.
answer: Do you know how we keep warm in Russia?

question: I can guess, baby.
answer: We play chess.

question: I guessed wrong.
answer: It takes a keen intelligence to play chess. Of course, you know what they say about men with big brains, don't you?

question: They wear large hats?
answer: No, they make better lovers.

question: Wrong again.
answer: I assume you know how to play.

question: Of course. The... horsey... moves in an L shape. Let's stop playing games with each other... especially difficult ones. May I ask you a question, Miss Humpalot?
answer: Of course.

question: Do I make you horny? Do I?
answer: I'll tell you anything you want to know, just make love to me. You are hairy, like an animal!

question: Grrrr, baby. Grrrr. Ruf! Ruf! Wait a tick, I don't want him watching me while I'm on the job!
answer: Make love to me, monkey man.

question: Groovy, baby!
answer: What's the matter?

question: Crikey, I've lost my mojo.
answer: Where is he? In here? Austin, I came as soon as I heard.

question: There must be some kind of mistake, Basil. Maybe I was drunk and I didn't know it.
answer: What's wrong with your neck, Austin?

question: I took a Viagra and it got caught in my throat. I've had a stiff neck for hours. Basil, is it true? Have I lost my mojo?
answer: We're going to run a few tests, Austin. Don't worry, old friend, we'll get to the bottom of this.

question: Alright, miss, just let me finish this article on the Suez crisis. What's going on?
answer: Alright, everyone, we're done.

question: But the test hasn't even started!
answer: Agent Haggerty was the test, Austin. Not only were you actually reading an article in that Playboy, but a candy-stripe nurse offering to give you a sponge bath didn't so much as turn your head.

question: Wait, I can explain, man! I was going to shag her but the article was so fascinating--
answer: I'm sorry, Austin, I'm afraid it's true

question: Without my mojo, I'm useless to the Ministry and to Her Majesty. I think it's time to retire.
answer: I'm afraid that's not possible, Austin. You see, Dr. Evil has returned.

question: Again?
answer: Again. We have evidence that Dr. Evil has developed a time machine. Our researcher noticed that these photos from the archives have changed. That means Dr. Evil is traveling back in time and creating alliances with each decade's most despised villains.

question: I can't read in the car. I get a bit vomy. Got it. I almost gipped.
answer: Our data indicates that Dr. Evil is in the year 1969. Luckily, we also have a time travel device. After years of research we've developed a machine that will transport you back to the Sixties.

question: But Basil, isn't that the new Volkswagen Beetle?
answer: That's what they'd like you to believe.

question: So, Basil, if I travel back to 1969 and I was frozen in 1967, I could go look at my frozen self. But, if I'm still frozen in 1967, how could I have been unthawed in the 90's and traveled back to the Sixties? Oh, no, I've gone cross-eyed.
answer: I suggest you don't worry about those things and just enjoy yourself.

question: This is smashing Basil. I'll go back to the Sixties, recharge my mojo, defeat Dr. Evil and be back in time for tea.
answer: Good luck, Austin.

question: Luck has nothing to do with it, Basil. Sorry. Swinging Sixties, here I come, baby, yeah! I feel better already, man! Alright, baby, a swinging shin-dig! 'THERE'S A SEXUAL REVOLUTION, YOU HEY, WATCH OUT SQUARES... YOU MAKES US BORED! THE PENIS IS MIGHTIER
answer: Care for a ride?

question: That's my Beetle, baby.
answer: It was your Beetle. Get in. Austin Powers, I presume?

question: Powers by name, Powers by reputation.
answer: Felicity Shagwell, CIA. Shagwell by name, Shag-very-Well by reputation.

question: Crazy, baby!
answer: Grab the wheel, would you? Well, Austin, I think this time you may have met your match.

question: Oh, I've beaten Dr. Evil before, and I'll beat him again.
answer: I was talking about me.

question: Welcome to my shag pad, baby. Care for something to drink? Or perhaps something to read? How about a hot cup of coffee?
answer: Yes, I rather fancy a grind.

question: Oh, Behave! Would you like a... mas-sage? A sensssual mas-sage? How does that feel, baby?
answer: Mmm, lower.

question: HOW DOES THAT FEEL, BABY?
answer: Wait, something's itching me. That's better.

question: Crikey!!! Sorry. Hello, anyone home? C'mon lads, do it for England.
answer: Oh, that was so relaxing. Felicity stretches very sexily.

question: Would you 'like to see my etchings?
answer: I think I'm ready for bed.

question: I'll get you some PJs.
answer: No, I'm ready for bed.

question: Oh, you'll want to clean your teeth then.
answer: No, I want to have sex with you, Austin.

question: Hello Vicar!
answer: I've studied everything about you- your methods, your accomplishments, your preferences. You're the reason I became a spy. Now, I've waited two years to meet you, so I say we get busy making up for lost time.

question: Felicity, I used to think that way, too, but I guess... I guess I've changed. Not to make a short story long, or to ramble on and on, or to keep talking in a repetitive manner ad infinitum until it becomes impossible to remember what I was talking about in the first place, but- where was I? Oh yes. Felicity, I can't shag you. I've lost my mojo.
answer: Oh.

question: I thought coming back to the Sixties would bring it back, but it hasn't.
answer: Austin, don't worry. I know just the man to help you. He's my guru. Ringo recommended him and he's the best.

question: I'll warm up the Jumbo Jet, baby!
answer: There he is. That's my guru. Guru, I'd like you to meet Austin Powers.

question: Hold your horses and any other beasts- of burden. I must lead my disciples in meditation and then I will help you.
answer: Ahhhhhh!

question: My name is the Guru Pitka. I am a spiritual teacher and I have combined many disparate disciplines into a unified movement of human potentiality and equipoise that I learned from my guru, the late Guru Shastri, a chaste man who died mysteriously of a disease that strangely had all the hallmarks of syphilis. He would say to me, Sparky, love is all, life is breath.
answer: Ahhhhhh!

question: Now, perhaps you are wondering where I got the nickname Sparky. Well, when we were young we used to play a game called "Stinkmop". We would urinate into a bucket, dip a mop into it, and play tag. I did not care for "Stinkmop" and a very wise old man said to me 'oh lighten up, Sparky', and I don't know, the name kind of stuck.
answer: Ahhhhhhhh...

question: Now, the reason I am a spiritualist instead of a therapist is that 'therapist' often becomes 'the rapist' and that will not help us attain potentiality. Now what is potentiality? It is the ability to achieve those goals that we wish to achieve for ourselves. People often say to me that they feel "nowhere", and I am going to change that to "Now here."
answer: Ahhhhhhh...

question: And you have many assumptions about your goals, but when you "assume" You make an "ass" out of "u" and "me".
answer: Ahhhhhhh....

question: The being, or that which we call 'ourselves', is not the tinker. It is not the taughts. It is the Gap between the tinker and the taughts! We are not our mind, we are not our body, we are the Gap!
answer: Ahhhhh...

question: The heart of the matter is that you are the heart of the matter. There is no "I" in "team". Beer before liquor, never sicker. Don't take a wooden nickel. If your pipe is short and your pump is weak, you better stand close or you'll piss on your feet. He who goes to bed with itchy bum wakes up with smelly finger.
answer: Ahhhhh...

question: Finally, the path to spiritual awakening requires the death of ego. Leggo of my ego! Let us end with the mantra
answer: Om Ay Vant Yu Uh... Mo Ay Vant Yu Uh... Mo Ay Vant Yu Hu.

question: Go with God, and pay at the door please. How can I help you?
answer: Guru, I'm having trouble performing.

question: What do you mean?
answer: You know- my bits and pieces are a bit sleepy.

question: I'm not understanding.
answer: I've forgotten the steps to the Mummy- Daddy dance.

question: Still not clear.
answer: My flag's at half mast and no one will salute it.

question: Sorry?
answer: My Willie don't work.

question: Why are you beating around the bush?
answer: That's my problem.

question: Alright, easy. Felicity and I were all set for some hump Olympics and I couldn't bat for six.
answer: Oh, yes, I see.

question: You have no idea what I'm saying, do you?
answer: Not a word.

question: Guru, I've lost my mojo.
answer: Oh, mojo! You should have said so. Well, you've lost your mojo because your chakras are misaligned. You have lost love.

question: She was an evil robot minion of Dr. Evil. I couldn't have loved her.
answer: Denial ain't just a river in Egypt, buddy. You will only get your mojo back when you surround yourself with love.

question: Oh, I get what you're saying now! He's talking about free love, baby! Tune in, turn on, and drop out!
answer: I am talking about true love. You must stay and study until you are worthy.

question: Well done, Fat Bastard. May I have the mojo?
answer: First things first, where's your shitter? I've gotta bleepin, turtle head pokin' out.

question: Right. Charming. Fat Bastard- you don't mind me calling you Fat Bastard do you?
answer: I've got a lot of demons kickin' around in my noggin, but weight issues ain't one of them.

question: Alright, Fatty-
answer: The name is Fat Bastard! I'm the incorrect weight for my height and I was born out of wedlock, hence the moniker Fat Bastard. Hey, I'm not kiddin'. I've got a crap on deck that could choke a donkey.

question: Fat Bastard, the mojo?
answer: Where's my money?

question: A gentlemen never discusses money.
answer: Fine, you can take your in' money and shove it up your , you stupid prick! While you're at it you can suck my greasy, two-toned !

question: Vulgarity is no substitute for wit.
answer: you!

question: Right. Bring in the money.
answer: Alright, here it is.

question: Mini-Me, fetch.
answer: Dr. Evil, I have some bad news. Austin Powers is back in the Sixties. One of our best assassins spotted him but he got away.

question: This is ri-goddamn-diculous, we have his mojo.
answer: There is another. Felicity Shagwell,

question: Scott, what are you doing here?
answer: I don't know, I was sitting around watching the tube and The Courtship of Eddie's Father came on Nick at Nite, you know, and I was just listening to that theme song-- Anyway it made me think that maybe we could try and work things out. You know, you are my Dad and I need you.

question: You had your chance, Scott. I already have someone created in my image. He's evil, he wants to take over the world, and he fits easily into most overhead storage bins. Has anyone seen Mini-Me? Mini-Me! Mini-Mouse? Mini-Driver? Hello! Mini Pearl? Can we put a frickin' bell on him or something? Gentlemen, phase three. We place a giant laser on the moon. Let me demonstrate. Where's my laser? Mini-Me, don't chew my laser. Not feeling well. He has an ear infection, but tit's OK. No? Nothing? Anyway, the laser is powerful enough to destroy every city on the planet at will. We'll turn the moon into what I like to call a "Death Star". What?
answer: Nothing Darth.

question: What did you call me?
answer: Nothing. Rip-off!

question: Bless you? Anyways, since my "death star" laser was invented by the noted Cambridge physicist, Dr. Parsons. I thought we'd name it in his honor-- the Alan Parsons Project. What now?
answer: The Alan Parsons Project was a progressive rock band from 1982. Why don't you just name it Operation Wang Chung, ass?

question: Actually, that was just footage from the 1996 blockbuster motion Picture Independence Day, but it would be a lot like that. What do you think, Scott?
answer: Yeah, Codename

question: Shhhh!
answer: I'm nineteen, I don't-

question: Shh! Shh-Shh. Shh-Shhhhhh-Shh. Shh- shh! It's Morse code. Let me decipher... it says 'shhhhh!'
answer: You are so lame-

question: This shag-in is gonna blow your mind, baby, yeah! You'll thank me later, baby. Hey! Ricardo Monteblan, how are you? Crazy, man!
answer: Let's split up and scope the scene.

question: Don't do anything I wouldn't do- at least not without me. Oh, behave! You're very exotic, baby. Do you have a little English in you? Would you like to?
answer: No, but I bet it really hurts.

question: The Austin Powers Sexy Dictionary defines an Eskimo hooker as a frosty prosty. Those are skin tight. How do you get into those pants, baby?
answer: Well you can start by buying me a drink. You're Thor? I'm tho thor I can hardly thit.

question: Hello, I am Baron Von Firstinbed. Last night I had German-Chinese food. An hour later I was hungry- for power. Did you hear about the contortionist who was engaged to be married?
answer: Yeah, I heard she broke it off. Look at that.

question: That's not a pretty sight. Who is he?
answer: Until recently he worked security for the MOD, but we think he might be a double agent, possibly for Dr. Evil.

question: How do you know?
answer: We've noticed that his lifestyle has changed dramatically. He's made a lot of cash purchases, he's hanging out with foxes half his age, and he's becomes quite a fixture on the London party circuit.

question: Who's the girl?
answer: I don't know, but it looks like he's splitting. I'll follow him. You see what you can get out of the girl. We'll rendezvous later.

question: Hello, hello. Who are you today, baby? Swallows? That's an interesting name. Are you English?
answer: German, actually. My maiden name is Spitz.

question: Well which is it, baby, Spitz or Swallows? Either way, it's a pleasure.
answer: The pleasure is mine.

question: Charmed, I'm sure. How do you do? Yes, quite. I always enjoy meeting new people. How's your mum? Good. I love shaking hands. So, who was your friend?
answer: His name is Fat Bastard.

question: It suits him.
answer: He's my lover.

question: OK. Would you happen to know if he's in business with a man named Mr. Evil?
answer: I don't know anyone named Dr. Evil.

question: Really? I said Mister Evil. Austin does a smug take. Something to drink? Would you like a Mister Pepper?
answer: Yes, I'd love a Doctor Pepper.

question: Really? I said Mister Pepper.
answer: You're a groovy boy, I'd like to strap you on sometime.

question: Can I ask you a question?
answer: Yes.

question: Thank you.
answer: Well, what's the question?

question: Oh, yes. Would you like to shag? Would you?
answer: I'd love to, Mr. Powers, just come right... over... here.

question: You're a bit of alright.
answer: Oedipus... use the revolver. Oedipus... use the machine gun. Oedipus, Oedipus...

question: Sorry baby, too late. He's as dead as vaudeville.
answer: You can't win, Powers. Dr. Evil has your mojo and it's only a matter of time before he kills you and takes over the world. Tell Fat Bastard I'll miss him...

question: Get me the President of the United States.
answer: Dr. Evil, what do you want?

question: Not what I want Mr. President, but I will receive. In 12 hours I will destroy Washington, DC with a giant laser. OK, Mini-Me, why don't you and the laser get a frickin' room. Honestly. I will destroy another major city every hour- that is, unless you pay me- One hundred billion dollars!
answer: Dr. Evil that's more than the entire federal budget for 1969.

question: Don't play games with me. The capitol will disappear if I don't receive One hundred billion dollars!
answer: That much money simply doesn't exist. I don't think l00 billion is even a number. It's like saying I want a kajillion bajillion dollars.

question: Come on, Mr. President... "Show me the money!"
answer: What?

question: "Show me the money!"
answer: I'm sorry, I don't understand.

question: Austin, tell me about the Nineties.
answer: You know I can't tell you details about the future, baby, it could alter history.

question: Not details, just what it's like. You know, what's the scene? Where's it at?
answer: There've been a lot of advances in the Nineties, baby. The economy is stable, people take better care of their health concern for the environment is on the rise and, um, let's see, there's an entire television channel dedicated to golf.

question: Sounds awful.
answer: It's not so bad once you get used to it. The Nineties are about responsibility. You know, having respect for yourself and other people. I even got married.

question: You? Married? What about the sexual revolution?
answer: Well, it turns out there were some casualties, baby. Don't you think you'll ever get married?

question: No, not until I get a little more 'experience' under my belt.
answer: Oh, behave! Oh my God!

question: What is it! Is it Fat Bastard?
answer: No, written here on my hand, see? Says 'Oh my God!'

question: Austin, look.
answer: Felicity, I haven't had this much fun since I worked undercover in Amsterdam-- '66 I think it was.

question: 1965, actually. You posed as a Dutch cheese expert to stop Dr. Evil from poisoning the world's water supply. I've studied your file, Austin. I want to be a trailblazer, just like you. The Seventies are right around the corner. It's going to be a glorious time for fashion and music and technology-- it won't be long before every flying car has its own 8-track. The CIA has always been a boy's club until now. Well move over, this chick's taking over.
answer: Very impressive.

question: Austin, your voice!
answer: Yes, I think I'm coming down with something. I'll get some ice cream. Would you like some?

question: No thanks.
answer: Could I have two scoops of Vanilla, please? Yes, please. I will, thank you. Yes please. No, laryngitis. Basil!

question: Could I have two scoops of Vanilla, please? Yes, please. I will, thank you. Yes please. No, laryngitis. Basil!
answer: Hello, Austin. What's wrong with your voice?

question: I just had ice cream. Listen to me, I have dairy throat. "Mary had a little lamb and it was always gruntin'. She tied it to a five bar gate and kicked it's little-
answer: Austin! Things are heating up, so I thought it best to contact you in disguise. Felicity, your plan worked. You and Austin track Fat Bastard back to Dr. Evil.

question: Well, thanks to your effort, Felicity, we now know that-
answer: Did you use an elaborate set of pulleys? A block and tackle?

question: Anyway, you two follow the signal back to Dr. Evil's headquarters and then-
answer: I just can't get my head around it, baby. You're so small and he's so ... not small. The sheer mechanics of it are mindboggling!

question: Never mind, Austin, you two have work to do. You must find Dr. Evil.
answer: I got it! A Chinese basket with a counter-weighted ballast. That's how you did it, right?

question: I got it! A Chinese basket with a counter-weighted ballast. That's how you did it, right?
answer: Austin, it almost sounds like you're jealous.

question: Who, me? That's not possible, baby! is it? Get down!
answer: We're obviously on the right track. It looks like Fat Bastard is-on an island in the middle of the ocean.

question: According to the readings, Dr. Evil's headquarters is over the next ridge.
answer: Can I have a look?

question: Sure.
answer: Question is, how do we get in?

question: Mmmmmmm...mmmmm...
answer: Austin, did you hear me?

question: I seem to be stuck in your dirty pillows.
answer: Where are the topographical maps that Basil drew up?

question: I think they're in the tent. Have you got it out yet?
answer: Good Lord, Austin, what sort of things do you put in there?

question: Oh, anything that catches my fancy.
answer: How do you manage to fit it all in?

question: Oh, it stretches to fit. Are you almost done? I can't hold it much longer.
answer: Here we go, one hammer. It's amazing how much this duffel bag will hold.

question: 'WHAT IF GOD WAS ONE OF US? JUST A SLOB LIKE ONE OF US?'
answer: Dr. Evil, that was fantastic, but I do have some bad news. Powers' is on the island.

question: How tedious.
answer: Don't worry, Dr. Evil, we can get to him by using the girl.

question: Really?
answer: I have the perfect weapon. Frau?

question: Do you want everything to go back in?
answer: Yes. Listen, Felicity, about Fat Bastard-

question: It's my job, Austin. You of all people should understand that. Marakesh, 1962. Rome, 1964. Tokyo, 1966. I know your record backwards and forwards. You've had more sex on the job than a Swedish stewardess.
answer: You're right, Felicity, I can't deny it. But the world changed, and I changed too. Ow! My back hurts.

question: Are you OK?
answer: I'm fine, just keeping packing.

question: I'm just waiting to taunt my nemesis. I have so few pleasures, you know. Ah, Mr. Powers, Ms. Shagwell, welcome to my hollowed-out volcano.
answer: We meet again, Dr. Evil.

question: Yes, the only reason I'm keeping you alive is so you can feel the agony of watching my plan unfold.
answer: Dr. Evil your plan will never--

question: Oh, is that yours?
answer: My mojo!

question: You know what they say
answer: Dr. Evil, do you like real estate?

question: Of course. Why?
answer: Now you've got a couple of achers.

question: Take them away.
answer: She just hoofed you in the sack and you're going to leave them alone in a jail cell with one inept guard? They'll escape, dipshit. You do this every time!

question: You're going the right way for a smacked bottom, young man.
answer: You don't own me!

question: How are we going to get out of here?
answer: Why don't you just shag Fat Bastard again?

question: Austin, that is it! I don't know what happened to you in the Nineties, but I'm still here, in the Sixties, and I still swing! Don't try to lay your hang-ups on me just because you lost your mojo! That one hurts.
answer: Ouch, baby, very ouch. I'm wounded.

question: I'm sorry, Austin, that was a cheap shot.
answer: No, baby, you're right. I was wrong to judge you. I guess I am... jealous.

question: But the Austin Powers I knew was wild and crazy and free. He could never be jealous.
answer: That Austin is gone. I've changed. I knew someone, not long ago, a very special woman. She taught me that life isn't about jumping into the sack with whoever comes along, it's about caring and responsibility. And while it is true she turned out to be an evil robot minion of Dr. Evil, I suppose I really did... love her.

question: Was that your wife?
answer: Yes, Vanessa.

question: Listen, Austin, I can't pretend to understand everything you've gone through, but I trust you. I'll make you a deal
answer: With me?

question: Yes, silly.
answer: Groovy, baby!

question: We need to lure the guard inside and get his key.
answer: Alright, what if I pretend to be desperately ill with food poisoning? The guard, drawn by my cries of pain, will come to investigate. Meanwhile, you dig a pit and line it with makeshift punji sticks made from sharpened toothbrushes. The guard falls in, Bob's your uncle, and we've got the key. What do you think?

question: That might work, but how about this? What do you think of these, my man? It's very hot in here, don't you think? It's very hot in here, don't you think? Austin!
answer: I'm very firmly wedged.

question: If you want something done...
answer: Almost... got it! Let's go get my mojo!

question: Smashing, Felicity, you were making me very horny, man! Extremely randy, indeed!
answer: C'mon, give the lads a show. Take of your top. Put 'em on the glass! Make 'em bounce. Let's have a look at your tits.

question: Fat Bastard!
answer: Looking for this, Mr. Powers?

question: Give me back my mojo, Fat Bastard!
answer: I give the orders, for brains. Guards, take them back to their cells.

question: I give the orders, for brains. Guards, take them back to their cells.
answer: Hold on, let me ask you one question.

question: Alright, I guess I owe you that much for a night of carnal ecstasy.
answer: Are you happy?

question: What kind of stupid ass question is that? I'm in' rich and I'm up to my tits in clean stinky.
answer: You didn't answer my question, are you happy?

question: It's about my girth isn't it? Sure I could lose a few pounds, but I could shiva git!
answer: Are you happy?

question: Hold on, I have something very important to do.
answer: How do you feel?

question: Sound as a pound, my spuds are boiling. Fancy a shag?
answer: Austin, we don't have time.

question: C'mon, luv, let's hop on the good foot and do the bad thing!
answer: Dr. Evil's taken his laser to the moon. The world is in danger.

question: Right, the moon. I think I know someone who can give us a lift. Gor blimey, you'd have to be a rocket scientist to figure this stuff out. Felicity, if you get frightened, just hold my hand.
answer: Yaaaaa-hoooo!

question: Position the laser. Get me the President. Mr. President, your time is up. This is your last chance to pay 100 billion dollars or see Washington DC destroyed.
answer: What? I can't hear you.

question: Pay me 100 billion dollars or see Washington DC destroyed!
answer: I'm sorry, I just can't hear you.

question: How about now?
answer: Better.

question: The Capital will be destroyed-
answer: Sorry! I just can't- I think it's that alarm.

question: Could someone shut off that frickin' alarm? I'm trying to hold the free world hostage here. Honestly. 100 BILLION DOLLARS!
answer: Please Dr. Evil, be reasonable. That's more money than is in the entire Federal Treasury!

question: Oh well, I guess you have one minute to- "show me the money"!
answer: I still don't know what that means. I can't show you the money because we don't have the money.

question: Let's find Dr. Evil.
answer: Shhh...

question: Austin, you've done it! You got Dr. Evil!
answer: Of course I did, baby, I got my mojo working overtime.

question: Austin, I'm going ahead. Cover my rear!
answer: Oh, behave! Poor little bugger. He's so small, he's like a dog or something. Poor little bugger. Felicity, be careful! Dr. Evil is still alive! Felicity? Alright, slap-head, turn around. Slowly.

question: Damn you, Powers!
answer: See, Dr. Evil I told you I could do both.

question: Perhaps you spoke too soon.
answer: Noooooo! Felicity! Felicity. Wake up! Wake up! Please God, don't take her away. Felicity, you have to understand, I thought I had my mojo back. This isn't fair. I love you, Felicity! I know I couldn't say it before, but I really do love you! Dr. Evil, I'll kill him!

question: You make love to your wife out of duty, your mistress for pleasure, and a Roman boy for ecstasy. Shit.
answer: I have to commandeer this vehicle. Hey, aren't you Hutch? I'm going to kill you, you bastard!

question: Before you do that, know this
answer: Really?

question: No. I can't back that up. I was just grasping at straws. I had nothing. But isn't it interesting, Mr. Powers, you really have become a product of the Nineties.
answer: How so?

question: You're more interested in your job as glorified policeman than you are in love. You won the battle, but I won the war. Love means nothing, you've proved it.
answer: I didn't think that Felicity was going to die, man.

question: What a cowardly response. I'm disappointed really. You have the power to go back in time and save her, but it means letting me go. Well, Mr. Powers, which is it going to be? Me or the girl?
answer: Felicity!

question: It looks like you have a choice
answer: I choose love, baby. Felicity, I love you.

question: I choose love, baby. Felicity, I love you.
answer: But I thought-

question: That was another place and another time, baby.
answer: Can't. Breathe.
